intro: Otidia dasycaulon, commonly known as the woolly clubmoss, is a small, evergreen plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its spore-bearing structures, called strobila, are clustered at the tips of its branches. Otidia dasycaulon plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
